title.value: Predatory birds of the Belarusian Poozerye

organization.name: Vitebsk State Univ. named after P.M.Masherov (Belarus)

person.name: Ivanovskij, V.V., Vitebsk State Univ. named after P.M.Masherov (Belarus)

abstract.value: In course of the research there were studied predatory birds of the Belarusian Poozerye (Lakeland). The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in the period from 1972 to 2011. As a result of realized research there were analyzed habitat placement and size, phenology, breeding, food chains of 21 species of birds of prey found in the Lake District. Among them - Osprey (Pandion haliaetus), the European Honey Buzzard (Pernis apivorus), the Red Kite (Milvus milvus), the Black Kite (Milvus migrans), the Montagu's Harrier (Circus pygargus), the Hen Harrier (Circus cyaneus) or Northern Harrier (in the Americas), the Western Marsh-harrier (Circus aeruginosus), the Northern Goshawk (Accipiter gentilis), the Eurasian Sparrowhawk (Accipiter nisus), the Rough-legged Buzzard (Buteo lagopus), the Common Buzzard (Buteo buteo), the Greater Spotted Eagle (Aquila clanga), the Lesser Spotted Eagle (Aquila pomarina), the Golden Eagle (Aquila chrysaetos), the White-tailed Eagle (Haliaeetus albicilla), the Peregrine Falcon (Falco peregrinus), the Merlin (Falco columbarius), the Red-footed Falcon (Falco vespertinus), the Common Kestrel (Falco tinnunculus). Based on the analysis of the negative factors that limit the size and deteriorate the condition of populations of birds of prey in the book were specific methodological developments in the protection of birds of prey in Belarusian Lakeland.
